entry.title: My Learning Journal on BTP (5) - Build A Small Finance Agent: CAP + Generative AI Hub + LangChain
entry.content:
Introduction

This is the fifth blog post in this series.

Good Receipt (GR) Invoice Receipt (IR) mismatches slow down clearing and add noise to month end close. The goal here is a build a small code-based finance agent that explains the mismatch and proposes a next step in one concise result. For example the proposal can be ‘Review invoice quantity against goods receipt and correct any discrepancies’ and ‘Post an adjustment to align GR and IR quantities or contact vendor for clarification on invoiced quantity’.

In my earlier blog on the Procure to Pay process (https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/step-by-step-to-run-a-simple-procure-to-pay-process/ba-p/13448109), the flow from purchase order to goods receipt and invoice receipt was introduced. As an FI consultant, a recurring question I faced is the GR IR mismatch. Why does a line stay open when quantities or values do not align across Purchase Order (PO), GR, and IR. This post continues that thread by introducing a simple finance agent that explains the mismatch and suggests what to do next.

The small finance Agent will be built with SAP CAP Cloud Application Programming Model and Node.js as a small web service that receives each request and communicates with the S/4HANA system. SAP Cloud SDK for AI forwards the request to SAP AI Core Orchestration, where a large language model does the reasoning. LangChain helps turn the request into clear instructions and keeps the answer tidy.

What the Agent delivers:

The response includes the status of the GR/IR check, short reason codes with brief explanations, and the key quantities such as ordered, received, and invoiced amounts. It also proposes a next action, and when appropriate, suggests a simple journal entry as a starting point.

Concepts Introduction                 

  • What is GR IR

GR IR means Goods Receipt and Invoice Receipt. In a P2P (Procure to Pay) flow, a purchase order is created, goods are received, and an invoice is posted.

GR is Good Receipt and IR is Invoice Receipt. A mismatch happens when the purchase order, receipt, and invoice do not align due to partial delivery, delayed posting, or price variance

  • What is Orchestration Workflow

Orchestration Workflows in SAP AI Core is a control layer that standardizes how an application calls large language models and tools. It prepares inputs with reusable templates, applies privacy and safety checks, selects the target model or tool, waits for the reply, and records usage and logs for monitoring and audit. The outcome is consistent, configurable, and reusable execution for every interaction.

Orchestration applies reusable steps such as grounding, templating, masking, and response formatting.

  • What is a ReAct Agent

In this blog post, I will build a ReAct agent. ReAct stands for Reasoning + Acting and follows a simple loop:

  • Thought: reason about the goal and context, decide the next step
  • Action: do one concrete thing, such as call a tool, query a system, or ask a model a focused question
  • Observation: read the result, update a scratchpad, then pick the next Thought

This loop repeats until the agent can return a clear answer.

There are different agent styles, for example ReAct, Plan and Execute, Function or tool-calling, Graph and Workflow agents. I will introduce them in future posts.

  • Agent VS Orchestration
  • What the agent owns
  • Planning the next step with the Thought → Action → Observation loop.
  • Choosing which tool or LLM to use and when to stop.
  • Keeping a scratchpad of evidence and reasoning.
  • What orchestration owns
  • Standardizing inputs and applying policies such as masking or filtering.
  • Routing to the selected model or tool with the right parameters.
  • Reliability, timeouts, retries, and observability.
  • An audit trail of every call.
  • How they work together
  • The agent decides what to do next and produces a clear call and parameters.
  • Orchestration executes that call safely and consistently and returns the result.
  • The agent writes the result into its scratchpad and continues the loop or finishes.
  • What is SAP Cloud SDK for AI

SAP Cloud SDK for AI is a developer kit that connects applications to model services through a single governed entry point. It provides client libraries, message templates, response formatting options, and helpers that integrate with platform services such as credential management and destinations. The value is reduced boilerplate, a unified call path, and consistent alignment with platform governance.

  • What is AI Core in BTP

SAP AI Core is a service on SAP Business Technology Platform for running and governing AI workloads. It offers orchestration for LLM access, policy controls for safety and consistency, deployment management, and usage tracking.

In this blog, AI Core serves as a single-entry point for model calls through Orchestration. Inputs and outputs pass through configurable safeguards and follow a consistent pattern, keeping configuration, policy, and observability in one place with steady behaviour.

  • What is LangChain

LangChain is an open-source toolkit for working with LLM. It provides prompt templates, output parsers, simple chains, and agent helpers. In this series it is used as glue that shapes business inputs into clear instructions for the model and checks that the answer fits the expected structure.

LangChain is used here to keep prompts and outputs consistent across model changes, to enforce a strict JSON schema for the GR/IR summary returned to the CAP service, to route tool calls in a clear ReAct loop without custom plumbing, to add lightweight validation and masking before and after the model call, and to make the agent logic easier to test and maintain with small, composable steps.

Architecture Design

The Agent runs as a small CAP service in the BTP subaccount. SAP Cloud SDK for AI sends requests to SAP AI Core, while LangChain helps format prompts, apply light masking, and validate outputs. When needed, the service reads business context from the S4HANA system through the Destination and the Connectivity service, which can pass the SAP Cloud Connector for on premise access.

Inside the Generative AI Hub, AI Launchpad manages access and AI Core executes an Orchestration flow with optional steps such as grounding, templating, translation, data masking, and filtering. Foundation Model Access then routes the call to a selected foundation model (LLM) and returns the result. Logs and usage are captured along the path so behaviour is observable and repeatable.

The response returns to the CAP service where the agent runs a ReAct loop: the model produces a Thought, the service parses the Action and invokes the corresponding tool such as an S4 query or posting check, records the Observation, and iterates until a Finish action is reached. The final answer is then shaped into an example finance summary.

Pre-request

  • A BTP subaccount with SAP AI Core Extended quota and an SAP AI Launchpad subscription.
  • The BTP subaccount should has the instances created of the necessary services.
  • In SAP AI Launchpad, open Generative AI Hub → Orchestration → Deployments. Select the target resource group with the selector at the top, confirm the deployment Status is RUNNING, then open the entry to view details and copy the API URL.
  • A service key for the SAP AI Core instance provided as the environment variable AICORE_SERVICE_KEY.
  • The Orchestration deployment API URL is stored in the environment variable ORCH_DEPLOYMENT_URL.
  • Development can run locally with Node.js 18 or later and the CAP command line interface, in SAP Business Application Studio or Visual Studio Code.
  • A S/4HANA system with the APIs activated and can be connected by SAP Cloud Connector.

Business/Function Background

Within SAP Financial Accounting (FI), GR/IR (Goods Receipt / Invoice Receipt) reconciliation ensures that the Good Receipt posted against a Purchase Order matches the corresponding Invoice Receipt. When a mismatch occurs, the review focuses on quantities, prices, or missing postings.

In this blog, there is a Purchase Order in the S/4HANA system shows an amount mismatch between GR and IR. The code-based Finance Agent analyses this PO by reading Good Receipt 101 movements and related supplier invoice (Invoice Receipt) references from S/4HANA through the corresponding APIs, then returns key information such as status, reason codes, ordered, received, and invoiced, and based on this information generates a suggestion and a proposal.

Configurations in SAP AI Launchpad and SAP AI Core

a. Generative AI Hub

Generative AI Hub is the area in SAP AI Launchpad where Foundation Models and Orchestration flows are managed. It provides a single entry point to select an LLM, deploy it into a Resource Group, and expose a stable endpoint for consumption. It also offers Usage Metering, Logs, and Access Control so activity is controlled.

In this blog, the first step is to configure the Orchestration flow in Generative AI Hub. The flow can include steps such as grounding, templating, translation, data masking, and filtering. Data masking is a key step, since it hides or replaces sensitive details such as credit card numbers, email addresses, or person names while keeping the business context usable. After data masking is configured, key information is masked before the request is sent to the LLM.

Another key configuration in orchestration is the model configuration. This step selects the LLM for the flow and sets parameters such as max tokens and temperature. Selecting a prefer LLM and keeping temperature low helps the flow return strict JSON consistently. The model configuration is saved with the orchestration workflow and becomes part of the deployed artifact in the selected resource group. After the workflow is built and deployed, the deployment exposes the live endpoint that the CAP Finance Agent service consumes.
‘Temperature’ controls randomness in word choice. Lower values produce more stable and repeatable answers, while higher values introduce more variation and creativity in the output.

The LLM can be used in the Orchestration configuration can be found under the Model Library.

b. Build and Deploy the Orchestration Flow

After the orchestration flow is configured, build and deploy it. The deployment appears in ML Operations → Deployments, grouped by Resource Group. When the status is RUNNING, open the entry and find the API URL. This URL is the live Orchestration endpoint consumed by outside.

Codes Snipes

In this blog, the Finance Agent uses real S/4HANA figures to form the recommendation and proposal. The key difference between an Agent and a simple Orchestration call is that the Agent iterates through a loop until the objective is fulfilled. It can fetch facts, re-evaluate, and only then finalize the result. In this scenario, LangChain structures the prompts, applies light masking, and drives a short loop that can add S/4HANA facts when confidence is low. A quality gate then requires a clear status, valid ordered/received/invoiced quantities, no uncertain reason codes, and a concrete suggestion with a practical proposal.

The agent runs up to three checks. For this agent, three rounds are sufficient to improve quality without unnecessary time or cost. If an early pass is not confident, the agent enriches the run with system of record data from S/4HANA so the explanation and recommendation reflect actual Good Receipt 101 totals and supplier invoice references. This is why an agent pattern is preferred over a single one shot call to the LLM.

Below are sample code snippets.

File structure

FinanceAgent/

└─ srv/

   ├─ service.cds

   ├─ agent-service.js

   └─ catalog-service.js

service.cds

Defines the Finance Agent action and the fixed seven field result, plus a small catalog view for PO headers.

using { cuid } from '@sap/cds/common';
@path: 'finance-agent'
@impl: './agent-service.js'
service FinanceAgentService {
  type CheckInput {
    companyCode        : String;
    purchasingDocument : String;
    item               : String;
    currency           : String;
    language           : String;
    email              : String;
    phone              : String;
    person             : String;
  }
  type CheckResult {
    status      : String;
    reasonCodes : array of String;
    ordered     : Decimal(13,3);
    received    : Decimal(13,3);
    invoiced    : Decimal(13,3);
    suggestion  : String;
    proposal    : String;
  }
  action check(input: CheckInput) returns CheckResult;
}

@path: 'catalog'
@impl: './catalog-service.js'
service CatalogService {
  .persistence.skip
  entity POs {
    key PurchaseOrder     : String(20);
        CompanyCode       : String(4);
        Supplier          : String(10);
        DocumentCurrency  : String(5);
        PurchaseOrderType : String(4);
        PurchaseOrderDate : Date;
  }
}

agent-service.js

Implements prompts, schema enforcement, light masking, a short quality gate, and a three round loop that can add S/4HANA facts.

  • Strict JSON schema and Orchestration clien
import { OrchestrationClient } from '@sap-ai-sdk/langchain'
import { JsonOutputParser } from '@langchain/core/output_parsers'

const RESPONSE_SCHEMA = {
  type: 'json_schema',
  json_schema: {
    name: 'finance_check',
    strict: true,
    schema: {
      type: 'object',
      properties: {
        status: { type: 'string' },
        reasonCodes: { type: 'array', items: { type: 'string' } },
        ordered: { type: 'number' },
        received: { type: 'number' },
        invoiced: { type: 'number' },
        suggestion: { type: 'string' },
        proposal: { type: 'string' }
      },
      required: ['status','reasonCodes','ordered','received','invoiced','suggestion','proposal'],
      additionalProperties: false
    }
  }
}

const client = new OrchestrationClient({
  llm: { model_name: process.env.MODEL_NAME || 'gpt-4o' },
  templating: { response_format: RESPONSE_SCHEMA }
})
const jsonParser = new JsonOutputParser()

Short prompt templates

The system template sets the overall instruction for the agent, telling it to act as a GR and IR reconciliation assistant and to return only valid JSON that matches the schema.
The user template shapes the specific business input, such as company code, purchase order, item, currency, and language.

import { ChatPromptTemplate } from '@langchain/core/prompts'

const SYS_TEMPLATE =
  'You are a GR/IR reconciliation assistant. ' +
  'Given the business inputs, analyze GR/IR and return ONLY valid JSON that matches the schema. No prose.'

const USER_TEMPLATE =
  'companyCode: {companyCode}, purchasingDocument: {purchasingDocument}, ' +
  'item: {item}, currency: {currency}, language: {language}'

const userPrompt = ChatPromptTemplate.fromTemplate(USER_TEMPLATE)

CAP wiring for 'Check' action

This handler connects the FinanceAgentService.check action to the implementation. Each request is passed to runAgent, which returns the strict JSON result or a controlled error payload.

import cds from '@sap/cds'

// runAgent is defined above in this file
export default cds.service.impl(function () {
  this.on('check', async req => {
    try {
      const res = await runAgent(req.data?.input || {})
      return res
    } catch (e) {
      const cause = e?.cause?.response?.data || e?.response?.data || e?.message || String(e)
      req.error(500, 'Orchestration call failed', { cause })
    }
  })
})

catalog-service.js

Communicates with S/4HANA using three OData APIs for PO header, GR 101 totals, and supplier invoice references.

// shared S4 fetch helper
export async function s4Fetch(path, params) { /* build URL with $format=json and sap-client, call fetch, return JSON */ }

// header
export async function fetchPOHeader(po) { /* call API_PURCHASEORDER_PROCESS_SRV A_PurchaseOrder('<po>') with $select fields */ }

// aggregates
export async function fetchAggFromGRIR(po, item) {
  // received from API_MATERIAL_DOCUMENT_SRV A_MaterialDocumentItem filter GoodsMovementType eq '101'
  // invoiced from API_SUPPLIERINVOICE_PROCESS_SRV A_SuplrInvcItemPurOrdRef
  return { ordered: 0, received, invoiced }

Result

The service returns a short, consistent result with seven pieces of information: status, reasons, ordered quantity, received quantity, invoiced quantity, a suggestion, and a proposal. It is easy to read and can be used by another system without extra work.

Before returning the suggestion and proposal, the service performs several checks. It verifies that the result follows the expected format, confirms that the quantities are valid numbers, and rejects any uncertain reason codes. If the outcome is not clear, it looks up real figures from S/4HANA such as Good Receipt 101 totals and related supplier invoice (Invoice Receipt) references, and then tries again. If the result is still not reliable, a controlled fallback message is provided instead of guessing.

The suggestion and proposal are generated based on these verified S/4HANA numbers. For example, if an invoice quantity is higher than the goods received, the output may include the suggestion “Review invoice quantity against goods receipt and correct any discrepancies.” and the proposal “Post an adjustment to align GR and IR quantities or contact vendor for clarification on invoiced quantity.”

Conclusion and Next Blog

The code-based Finance Agent delivers a small, consistent result for GR and IR reconciliation using the S4HANA figures, a quality gate, and a suggestion with a proposal.

The next blog will deepen the design by introducing MCP to standardize how context and tools are supplied to the model, using LangGraph to organize the iterative flow into compact nodes for prompting, grounding, validation, and decision, adding A2A handoff so one agent can request checks or approvals from another agent.

If you are also interested in AI, you can find me on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/zhengzhang-jason-lu-42574b41/

Keep learning, keep growing.

entry.title: deprecated Job Section field in Employee Central
entry.content:
We have an issue with the implementation of our Employee Central integration and need confirmation from SAP over a technical question. It relates to a field (called Job Section) which SAP have communicated is deprecated, but they haven’t removed it. 

Our SuccessFactors build requires the Job Section field to be enabled (the system is configured to check two fields for the Paygroup ID, the Job Section being one of these fields)  

Our customer does not currently use this section, but they have proposed a workaround to help unblock the issue. 

What we require is confirmation from SAP that they will not remove the deprecated Job Section field in the future – otherwise the proposed workaround will not work.

entry.title: Enable Now Data Integration into SAP Analytics Cloud
entry.content:
Greetings Community!

Currently, I manually transfer content data from SAP Enable Now, cloud edition  (SEN) to SAP Analytics Cloud  (SAC) each month using Excel, for review purposes. While SEN documentation indicates that data can be integrated into Microsoft Power BI, I have not found information regarding integration with SAC

Is there a way to establish a direct connection between SEN and SAC to ensure continuous and accurate data synchronization, eliminating the need for manual uploads? Thanks for any insight!

Best,

Andrew

entry.title: Re: SAP Document AI — Smarter, Faster, and More Efficient Document Processing
entry.content:
Hi @tomasz_janasz,

do you have any updates when the new features will go live? I guess the embedded version can be consumed from SAP BTP from everyone with a BTP account or are there any restrictions (need another product... etc)? So is it stand alone with the new features?

We are exploring the current version that is free on BTP but it seems to miss most of the features of this new version. We have a customer that needs e-mail input, a ui for fast confirmation and api calls later. So in case it is possible to try a pre version, we would be interested!

entry.title: Re: CrystalDecisions.Shared.CrystalReportsException is no...
entry.content:
First issue is you are using 13.0.2000.0, that suggests your are using a VERY OLD version of CR's .NET assemblies. 2000 is the old 2.0/1.2 Framework required, newer versions will show them as 13.0.4000.0.

You need to upgrade to the latest SP 38 from here:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SUPPORT_CONTENT/crystalreports/3354091173.html?locale=en-US

See this blog I wrote to upgrade to current versions:

Upgrading a Visual Studio 2008->2022 .NET project with the latest CR .NET SDK packages

Quick upgrade note, project must be set to 4.7 or 4.8 Framework, only supported versions now.

Second is not the location of the Assemblies have changed.

Third is when you upgrade to SP 38 uninstall the previous version first and right click on the EXE, note there are separate installers for VS 2010->2019 and a 64 bit installer for VS 2022, install the 32 bit runtime also at the end of the installer, it's required only for the VS install.

See if that resolves your issues.

entry.title: Re: My Learning Journal on BTP (5) - Build A Small Finance Agent: CAP + Generative AI Hub + LangChai
entry.content: Great blog @JasonLu !..  you can improve with good quality images in your blog.. so it looks more even attractive and more readers.

entry.title: Re: Effortless Integration: Archiving Service Cloud V2 Emails to OpenText
entry.content:
Thank you for your kind remarks.

To answer your question, this was done as a POC for a customer to which we spec'd out only polling the last email and processing from there. 

In your case, you could easily read the emails, parse out each unique UUID and fetch the email contents with attachments and then send them over to OT.

entry.title: SAP Business One UI Configuration + Boyum Item Placement Tool
entry.content:
What is the exact method to use UI Configuration and Boyum IPT.

UI Configuration:
US Simple
1. Should I create another Group such as "Company Base" copy from US Simple and then make edits.
2. Apply a user.
3. Use IPT for Function Buttons

If I do that and then I need to make a change in one of the tabs or Form Settings in UI Configuration, is that okay?
In my experience as soon as make any change even an active/non-active status on a matrix col. It places all the IPT buttons on the UI including the US Simple.

Your help is greatly appreciated. If you have a how-to/tutorial video I would greatly appreciate it.

entry.title: Add a new payment block other than (R) for Invoice blocked workflow purposes
entry.content:
Hi SAP community,

I need to configure a new payment block that is not the standard "R" code and would be used when the payment is blovked for a financial invoice and it has to go through a worflow. 

I was able to add the new reason code in OB27 but I can't find a way to replace it ; whenever I post an invoice with a wrong amount / date / quantity, etc, the standard "R" code is always showing..

Do you have any idea how to configure it ?

thank you

entry.title: Re: UI Configuration and Boyum IPT
entry.content: We are using SAP 10 Client.

entry.title: Re: SAP MDG vs ​SimpleMDG
entry.content: Hi Jon, would you be able to share more information regarding EAM capabilities?

entry.title: Re: When will we leave cave painting behind us?
entry.content: Hi @alexfinger! It's a really good point, and I have to say I loved that image (very creative!). I believe we’re in a kind of transition, because with agents the focus of UI can shift toward machines. It will become more and more common for interfaces to be optimized for machines rather than humans (and their language), as a growing number of operations will be carried out agent-2-agent.

thx

entry.title: Romania New Employee Register (REGES ONLINE)- registration deadline extended until December 31, 2025
entry.content:
Dear customers,

I am bringing to your attention that on September 18, 2025 appeared one official statement from Ministry of Labor that the Government  approved the extension of the deadline for the transition from the Revisal system to the REGES-ONLINE platform until December 31, 2025. Here is the official communication:

https://mmuncii.ro/j33/index.php/ro/comunicare/comunicate-de-presa/7774-inscriere-reges-18092025

In addition, in today's Official Gazette no. 863/September 19, 2025 it was published Emergency Ordinance 46/2025, which confirms this extension of the deadline for the transition from the Revisal system to the REGES-ONLINE platform until December 31, 2025 :  https://monitoruloficial.ro/Monitorul-Oficial--PI--863--2025.html

Have a great day and all the best,

Gabriela Ianculescu

entry.title: Re: How to display custom MIGO fields in Stock – Multiple...
entry.content:
Hello Tharma! Thank you for your question!

It is possible to add a custom field to the filter list by using the concept of  Data Source Extensions – Part 2.

Steps:

1.Open the Custom Field App via the Adapt UI button.

2. Create your Data Source Extension.

3. Click on the flag icon to view more details.

4. Check the option Custom Text and rename the field as needed.

5. Refresh the Stock – Multiple Materials app and select the new field.

Hope it helps.

entry.title: Need to send Date Created and Start Date via OData API
entry.content:
We need to send the Date Created (dateCreated) and the Start Date (startDate) using  OData API for the Time to Fill values. When doing this call, we are not getting values back. 

We need to know where to get these two values from. 

Module:  RCM 

Values: 

  • Date Created (dateCreated) 
  • Start Date (startDate)

entry.title: Re: BTP Cloud Foundry trial - InsufficientResources - Ins...
entry.content:
I was also facing the same issue deploying the sap cap application with postgres database.

I was able to solve the issue after updating the memory to 256M in the module parameters

entry.title: Re: Backup & Restore Approach for SAP HANA Systems with Encryption Enabled
entry.content:
Thanks a lot Prashant for this comprehensive blog post about Backup & Recovery encryption!

The only change I would like to ask for is, to drop one of the labels on top within the "SAP MANAGED TAGS" :
In SAP HANA Cloud, HANA database customers have no possibility to access or execute hdbnsutil as described in this blog post.
Accordingly, this blog post is purely about SAP HANA 2.0 (of course, also this could be operated in environments of our cloud service provider partners, but still would not be named SAP HANA Cloud) and should be labeled as such only with SAP HANA. 

Thanks a lot
Ralf
SAP HANA & HANA Cloud Product Management

entry.title: Re: Vacant Position not Visible on Succession Org Chart
entry.content:
HI @srmuvva,

 

Based on the error message this is a permission issue. If you are using MDF Position Nomination Method, check position object target population. Most likely the position is not part of user's target population. You have an option to set it to All so that user would be able to see the position in the Org Chart.

 

Thanks,

Gerald

entry.title: Re: Fiori Launchpad - Notification Configuration
entry.content:
Thanks a lot for all the efforts. Now, we can do it, but we don't know why we do it. Below are some links to the SAP Help to understand a little better.

In the SAP Help, your blog post corresponds to the scenario "Embedded Scenario" (as you have said) which is described in the SAP Help, i.e. the hub and the backend are on the same ABAP server instance, but you have also mixed it with bgRFC which is only related to "Hub deployment". I have tested it successfully in my system without the bgRFC setup defined in your chapter 6.

Link: Notification Channel Configuration | SAP Help Portal

All the steps are described in the SAP Help with more explanations (but not with the screenshots, thanks for that again).

For the Embedded Scenario, there's no need to create any RFC destination and all bgRFC stuff. In the activity "Enter the Notification Hub RFC Destination", enter the predefined RFC destination "NONE".

Also, the notification provider /IWNGW/DEMO in chapter 7 is only required if you want to send a notification described in chapter 9 Scenario 1 Demo. Note that the transaction code /IWNGW/BEP_DEMO in chapter 7 requires that the tested provider is named /IWNGW/DEMO or /IWNGW/DEMO_EXT, no other name is supported. That explains why you have named it /IWNGW/DEMO in the chapter 7, and so people should not try to use another name.

In chapter 9, you don't repeat how to activate the notification provider (SAP_BUSINESS_WORKFLOW), it's the SPRO activity "Manage Notification Providers":

Concerning the workflow configuration, here's the link to the SAP Help in the SAP Business Workflow chapter:

Enabling Push Notifications | SAP Help Portal

entry.title: ODATA call to RODPS_REPL_ODP_GET_DETAL for std CDS view gets cs_sy_move_cast_error
entry.content:
Hi - I am calling the ODP context ABAP_CDS with ODP name IFIGLACCTLIR$F (ACDOCA)  via Synapse Analytics - however Synapse never gets a response - When using external debugging the sap side is getting a cs_sy_move_cast_error in RODPS_REPL_ODP_GET_DETAL line 134.. 

Only via external - ODATA - if I execute the FM directly in S/4 all works fine: 

I_SUBSCRIBER_TYPE = RSODP_ODATA

I_CONTEXT =  ABAP_CDS

I_ODPNAME = IFIGLACCTLIR$F

I_TYPEVERSION = 0

I_HIER_FLATTENING = NULL

This is happening on our production system - but can replicate in sandbox as well.

entry.title: Re: The report contains a Microsoft Word OLE Object. When...

There was a quick fix but that caused another issue.

R&D is looking into the issue and currently there is no work around.

Something did change, because until I used your file I didn't have the problem, what that is though I don't know...

entry.title: Re: ODATA call to RODPS_REPL_ODP_GET_DETAL for std CDS view gets cs_sy_move_cast_error
entry.content:
TRY.

lr_hierodp ?= lr_odp.

IF i_hier_flattening EQ 'X'. " no segments

ELSE.

DATA: ls_segments TYPE rodps_repl_s_segment.

ls_segments-segment = '$S_HEADER'. CLEAR ls_segments-parent.

APPEND ls_segments TO et_segments.

READ TABLE et_fields WITH KEY segment = '$T_HEADERTEXTS'.

IF sy-subrc = 0.

ls_segments-segment = '$T_HEADERTEXTS'.

ls_segments-parent = '$S_HEADER'.

APPEND ls_segments TO et_segments.

ENDIF.

READ TABLE et_fields WITH KEY segment = '$T_ELEMENTS'.

IF sy-subrc = 0.

ls_segments-segment = '$T_ELEMENTS'.

ls_segments-parent = '$S_HEADER'.

APPEND ls_segments TO et_segments.

ENDIF.

READ TABLE et_fields WITH KEY segment = '$T_FOLDERTEXTS'.

IF sy-subrc = 0.

ls_segments-segment = '$T_FOLDERTEXTS'.

ls_segments-parent = '$T_ELEMENTS'.

APPEND ls_segments TO et_segments.

ENDIF.

READ TABLE et_fields WITH KEY segment = '$T_INTERVALS'.

IF sy-subrc = 0.

ls_segments-segment = '$T_INTERVALS'.

ls_segments-parent = '$T_ELEMENTS'.

APPEND ls_segments TO et_segments.

ENDIF.

ENDIF.

CATCH cx_sy_move_cast_error.  (this is line 134)

entry.title: Does updating a table with a LOB column but not including the LOB in the UPDATE cause fragmentation?
entry.content:
Hi,

Updating a LOB column in HANA cause fragmentation since the "old" LOB object is not deleted right away but instead marked for deletion for later. This is then cleaned up by the garbage collector which is run once a day. You can manually reclaim the space caused by the fragmentation using `ALTER TABLE <table_name> LOB REORGANIZE`

My question is, does the same happen if I were to update a table with a LOB column but not include the LOB in the UPDATE?

Thanks.

entry.title: Basic Tips for Beginners in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) with BW Live
entry.content:
Beginner Tips for SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) with BW Live Connection

While working in SAC, I faced some common challenges. Here are the problems and how I solved them:

1. Story and Page Filters with BW Live Data

    • Problem: I was not sure whether SAC filters process locally or in BW.
    • Solution: Filters always trigger BW to recalculate and send back results. Only cosmetic changes (sort, format, hide columns) happen in SAC.

2. Scripting – Dynamic Input Handling

    • Problem: When using input fields, numbers were treated as text and gave wrong results in calculations.
    • Solution: Convert string to number:
    • var numberValue = ConvertUtils.stringToNumber(InputField_1.getValue());

3. Debugging Data in a Widget

    • Problem: I could not see what exactly my table widget was holding in the backend.
    • Solution: Use ResultSet in script:

              var resultset = Table_1.getDataSource().getResultSet();

              console.log(resultset);

This showed me all members and values in console.

4. Performance Issue with Dimensions

    • Problem: My story was very slow though I used only few attributes in the widget.
    • Solution: Reduced unnecessary attributes in the model → story became faster.

✅These are small but practical solutions that helped me when starting SAC development. I hope this helps other beginners too.

entry.title: Re: How to avoid partials supplies
entry.content:
Below are some approaches you can explore

Enable batch management for cable materials. Maintain batch characteristics like:

  • Available length per reel
  • Shielding type
  • Wire section

During PR or reservation, use batch selection criteria to ensure only batches with sufficient length are considered. This ensures that only batches with ≥ required length (e.g., 20m) are proposed.

Treat each reel as a serial number or equipment. Maintain the actual length in the serial/equipment master. During picking or goods issue, validate that the selected reel meets the full requirement. This avoids combining multiple reels unless explicitly allowed.

Implement a custom enhancement in MRP or reservation logic. Check available stock for full-length pieces. If not available, trigger external procurement for full length. Prevent partial picking from warehouse. This requires ABAP development but gives full control.

entry.title: Re: How to check the breakup of the Planned value of Good...
entry.content:
Use transaction CO03, go to the Components Overview tab, Check material numbers, Quantities, Planned values (based on BOM and routing) and Valuation type and price control (Standard/Moving Average). This shows what SAP planned to issue and at what value.

Use transaction MB51 or COGI, filter by Movement type 261, your production order number. Review Actual quantity issued and Actual value posted. This helps identify what was actually issued and at what cost.

Use Report S_ALR_87013019 – Order Report. This report provides a detailed comparison of Planned vs actual quantities, Planned vs actual values and Component-level breakdown

entry.title: Re: 'Modify' stmt showing sy-subrc = 0 for duplicate record
entry.content:
I have few new remarks after reading again your initial question, and your extended question in the comment.

  1. Q1: modify dbtab returns sy-subrc = 0 but you say it's not updating.
  2. Q2: you want to know which lines are not updated if MODIFY dbtab returns sy-subrc = 4.

Concerning Q1, it's not possible that one line is "not updated" but sy-subrc = 0, so check twice, but if it's confirmed, it's a critical failure so contact the SAP support first, then your database vendor. It's more likely that the concerned line appears twice or more in your internal table, and the last one applies (NB: which one is the "last one" is not documented in the ABAP documentation). To avoid this kind of issue, use an internal table with a unique key corresponding to the database table and make sure to not short dump your program by attempting to insert a duplicate key in the internal table. Another reason could be that the program does additional updates or rollbacks or whatever.

Concerning Q2, there's no reason to write some additional code to find the lines which could not be inserted if sy-subrc = 4 and the database table has no secondary unique index. This case won't happen. If it happens that a secondary unique index exists, the solution is to rollback and fail the program, to remove the secondary unique index or make it not unique, not to find the lines which have not been inserted. Note that in case your database table has a secondary unique index, you should not use "MODIFY dbtab FROM TABLE itab" but instead use either UPDATE dbtab FROM TABLE itab followed by INSERT dbtab FROM TABLE itab or use LOOP AT itab INTO wa followed by MODIFY dbtab FROM wa, as explained in the ABAP documentation: https://help.sap.com/doc/abapdocu_latest_index_htm/latest/en-US/index.htm?file=abapmodify_source.htm#!ABAP_ALTERNATIVE_2@2@. If you really want to know the duplicates, go to the solution of LOOP AT itab INTO wa followed by MODIFY dbtab FROM wa.

entry.title: How to make certain fields appear only on the second-to-last page in Adobe form?
entry.content:
Hi All,

   Now I am working on development of an Adobe form. there are two master pages,  master page1 is used to output sales order data, and the master page2 is only output some text. If there is a large amount of items data, the master page1 will output multiple times, but the master page2 will only output once. 

    There is a field named "total amount" in master page1(not in design view),    this field should be output only in last page of mater page1,  I try to use below JS to control the output ,but it doesn't work. It does not display on any of the pages.

var totalPages = xfa.layout.pageCount();
var currentPage = xfa.layout.absPage(this);

if (currentPage == (totalPages - 1)) {
    this.presence = "visible";
} else {
    this.presence = "hidden";
}

but if I swap the positions of these two control statements, like below code , this field will output on all mater page1.

var totalPages = xfa.layout.pageCount();
var currentPage = xfa.layout.absPage(this);

if (currentPage == (totalPages - 1)) {
    this.presence = "hidden";
} else {
    this.presence = "visible";   
}

 Could anyone please tell me how to implement this function? Thank you.

entry.title: Notification in SVT when registration data is not maintained
entry.content:
Hello All,

We have a scenario where we don't have Registration for Substances maintained in Property Tree. In this case., we want to send a notification to Stakeholders on the first order for any Material containing this substance. And once Registration data is maintained, then only send notification after 70% of Threshold (for example) or falling back on the Standard configuration for Reactions in SAP SVT Classic. 

One option that we looked at was to maintain Information Threshold to 1% or very low so that notification is sent, but then it will send notification all the time, for more substances then we intend to. And second option was to have a report from SAP for this.

I would like to check anyone has come across this scenario and managed it some other way which could be a better fit.

entry.title: Re: How to Pack Cartons onto Pallet automatically in SAP...
entry.content:
Dear @Lakshmi_Priya96 ,

you can find the relevant information in the SAP Help Portal here:

Automatic Packing – Packing with Packing Instructions 

In your case we are talking about Nested Handling Units for which you need to create Multi-Level Packing Instructions.

In your particular case, you need to create a packing instruction for the carton which should contain the packaging material and the item which should be packed.

In addition to that, you need to create a second packing instruction, which contains the pallet as packaging material and the subordinate packing instruction of the carton packing instruction you created in the first place.

As a next step you need to create the determination record for the determination type.

 

best regards,

Marius

entry.title: Re: Replicate by Replication Model App in SAP Cloud ERP
entry.content:
Hello @F_Coutinho 

Thank you for your question and the detailed screenshots.

Have a look at these links Maintain Business Roles Within the SAP S/4HANA Cloud, How to Create and Assign Spaces and Pages & Replicate by Replication Model for details.

The issue you face often happens when you manually add catalog to your copied role without correct launchpad assignments. This means the app tile will not appear even if the catalog technically contains the app. This is why after you recreated the role from the standard template, the system automatically brought in the correct catalog and mappings, hence enabling the app to become visible.

The best practice in public cloud is to:

  • Always start by copying the delivered SAP_BR_CONF_EXPERT_BUS_NET_INT template.
  • If you need to extend access, add additional catalogs or registrations but do not remove the default pages or space.
  • Ensure you assign the role to the user if necessary.
  • Finally, log out and back in or refresh the Fiori launchpad cache.

I hope this provides the desired insight. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Thanks for attending SAP Tech Night at SAP Labs Gurgaon – A Night of Ideas, Inspiration & Community
entry.content:
SAP Tech Night at SAP Labs Gurgaon – A Night of Ideas, Inspiration & Community 🌙💡

Yesterday, we had the privilege of hosting  SAP Community Tech Night at SAP Labs Gurgaon, and what an incredible evening it turned out to be! 

The Flow of the Evening 🌟

✨ A Warm Beginning

The evening began with my welcome to everyone and a brief sharing of the agenda, followed by Jitan Batra and Neeraj Manocha, who painted a vivid picture of the SAP Community journey—from Stammtisch and Tech Nights to Inside Tracks. Their words reminded us that behind every great community lies the spirit of people coming together, sharing, and growing.

⚡ The Future with SAP Joule
I had the opportunity to present SAP Joule—exploring its role for developers, consultants, studios, skills, automation, and agents. What struck me most wasn’t just delivering the session—it was the spark in the room, the curiosity, and the conversations that followed. The future of work with Joule feels closer than ever.

🤖 AI Transforming Support
Nirjar Gandhi then took us on a journey into AI-driven customer support, showcasing tools like Early Watch, Application Conversion Assistant, App Inspector in S/4HANA 2025, and Intelligent Log Analysis. It was one of those sessions that made us realize—AI isn’t a buzzword here, it’s solving real problems today.

🌍 Rise with SAP
Closing the formal sessions, Niharika Razdan spoke about Rise with SAP and how it’s reshaping ERP. Her perspective on the role of SAP Basis consultants sparked important discussions about career growth, transformation, and the opportunities ahead.

🤝 Networking & Next Steps
The networking session was buzzing—people exchanging ideas, making plans, and brainstorming about the upcoming SAP Inside Track Gurgaon on 15-Nov-2025. It was community in action, and it felt powerful.

🍴 Dinner Together
Finally, over dinner, conversations flowed as naturally as the food. Because at the heart of every great community event is not just learning together, but also sharing a meal and building friendships.

Gratitude 🙏

  • To the speakers for making the sessions insightful and inspiring.

  • To the attendees from across SAP, IBM, TCS, Accenture, Capgemini, The Silicon Partner, and more – for bringing your passion and energy.

  • To SAP Labs Gurgaon – for hosting us so warmly.

  • To everyone who supported and organized behind the scenes – you made it all possible.

What’s Next? 🚀

The excitement doesn’t end here. With discussions already underway for the SAP Inside Track Gurgaon, we’re just getting started.

Last night reminded me of this truth: Technology changes fast, but it’s the people, the community, and the shared learning that make the biggest difference. And that’s what SAP Community is all about.

👉 Were you part of SAP Tech Night? Share your favorite highlight or takeaway in the comments—I’d love to hear your perspective!

On behalf of SAP Community NCR

entry.title: Re: How to create ODATA v4 POST API where it will take in...
entry.content:
Hello @OmkarVB, you can set up a function import to be called either using a GET or a POST HTTP request, so to answer your question, yes you can pass your structure or parameters in the body of the POST request you just need to specify the type of request in the table if function import in SEGW

Note: Passing the parameters in the request body only work if you are using OData V4.

You can reference from SAP Help here: https://help.sap.com/docs/ABAP_PLATFORM_NEW/68bf513362174d54b58cddec28794093/c5dc22512c312314e10000000a44176d.html

entry.title: Re: Notification in SVT when registration data is not mai...
entry.content:
Hello

you need to be more precise. SVT support two legal demands.

One there the relevant object has a "registriation limit" (e.g  REACH like registrations); and one for this is not the case (most of the other "non Reach like" reglations)

in the SVT set up: there is (in most of the case) not"good practical" set up possisble if you stick to SAP Standard to generate the mail ( i need to skip details)

Regarding your story: for me it is not clear: Do we talk about a "REACH" like regulation or something different

Anyhow: as mentioned: if you stick to SAP standard: you will get "many notifications" by day if the same material under some conditions ins in scope. 

MOst of the people (in know) are very unhappy with this kind of set up

E.g. as references:

https://community.sap.com/t5/product-lifecycle-management-q-a/svt-standard-emails-are-not-generating-even-though-volume-is-tracked-and/qaq-p/12781781

https://community.sap.com/t5/product-lifecycle-management-q-a/svt-monitoring-emails-were-not-generating/qaq-p/479173

https://community.sap.com/t5/product-lifecycle-management-q-a/svt-check-in-ehs/qaq-p/10147268

And may be more.

Wish best wishes

C.B.

PS it is not a good idea to use the eMail option if more than 10% of data is missing. Limitations are as: You can specify only one email address; the eMail content "looks not so niece" etc.

entry.title: All the partners are not copied into billing document item from sales order item
entry.content:
Hi All,

Have maintained copy controls from Sales order to Billing properly, 

let say in Sales order item , we have 10 partners but when we have created billing document then at billing item level only 5 partner's are copied ( App : Manage Billing Document ) and saved it. But if i open the same billing document of GUI app then i can see all the billing item partners.  

Upon analysis understood that in public cloud - if the billing partner header and item partner are same then those partners are not copied at item level only the unique partners are copied at billing document item level.

Can any one please confirm is this the expected behaviour or is there any config where all the sales order item partners can be copied to billing item partners.

Thanks a lot

entry.title: Re: ODATA call to RODPS_REPL_ODP_GET_DETAL for std CDS view gets cs_sy_move_cast_error
entry.content:
@Janet2- You can check ST22, where you should find runtime error logs. This will help you determine where and why you are getting the error.

There are two possibilities besides that.

  1. Either Synapse Analytics sends an unacceptable value for a field or fields, so the ST22 runtime error can provide a clue.
  2. Since it's related to the standard object IFIGLACCTLIR$F (ACDOCA) and RODP_REPL_ODP_GET_DETAIL, there might be an issue. Therefore, search SAP Notes and Knowledge Base Articles (KBAs) on SAP Support; there might be an SAP Note to fix the issue.

Good luck!

Thanks,
Tuncay

entry.title: Contract type field in Successfactors story
entry.content:
Hi

Hopefully I really simple question to answer please. I'm working with a Story report in our live production environment.

In the Job Information table, Contract Type is not listed. Even though its in the employee information in the Job Information section it’s just not listed in the table. I'm really baffled as to why this field is not visible in the table. I'm just wondering if anyone else has seen this issue and has a workaround please? I assume its not a permissions issues as that would be weird for this particular Field.

I know there are separate country tables which has Contract Type but there are about 80 of them. I am going to go through them all. I  just wondered if anyone else has experienced this as it seems very strange that 1 field in the job info section in someone's profile, is not available in the standard Job Info table. Why, if I find it, would this particular field be in a random country table on its own? Makes no sense to me.

Thanks in advanced.

entry.content: Hi Don,

entry.title: Re: How to distinguish the Valuation Class of T stock and...
entry.content:
Hello @jason_su 

Thank you for your question.

Yes, you are right that in On-Premise conflicts between POD and MTO regarding the valuation class can be solved using the BAdI you mentioned. In Public Cloud however, that BAdI is not available because classic enhancement spots are restricted. Instead, you have alternative mechanisms to control valuation class assignment without custom coding

The Public Cloud offers you better solution such as:

  • Split your Valuation through valuation category
  • The option to carry out your valuation class through account determination groups
  • Ability to extend based on event through In-App Extensibility

If you decide to use the public cloud, I recommend to:

First, try to solve it with the Split Valuation or Account Determination Group. This case is configuration driven and it adheres to the clean-core approach.

Check if there is an exposed In-App BAdI in the custom fields and logic app. This, only if your requirement cannot be mapped with standard options.

Consult Split Valuation, Extensibility for Account Determination & Custom Business Objects, Fields, and Logic for more details.

I hope this provides the desired insight. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: How to count distinct numbers from a internal table using SAP ABAP 7.5 ?
entry.content:
Hi experts,

A simple internal table like this :

COMP      ID1       ID2

1000         A1        B1

1000         A1        B2

1000         A2        B2

1000         A3        B2

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

The result I need is : 

COMP         COUNT(distinct ID1)         COUNT(distinct ID2)

1000                               3                                              2

 

How to achieve this using SAP ABAP 7.5 ?

Tks.

entry.title: Re: BP tab not enabled
entry.content:
Possible root causes for Organization tab not enabled in BP are

  • The business partner role (e.g., FLVN00, FLVN01, FLCU00, FLCU01) might not be assigned correctly.
  • You may have selected a business partner type (e.g., person or group) that doesn’t support organizational data.
  • Customizing in transaction BUPT or SPRO might not have enabled the organization tab for the selected role.

Then, for the other issue Reconciliation Account not connected to Company Code, the possible root causes are

  • The BP may not be extended to the company code in the customer role.
  • The account may not exist or be valid for the selected company code.
  • The company code view might be missing or not saved properly.

To fix both the above issues, go to BP, create or change BP with type Organization, assign role FLCU01 (Customer - Company Code), Ensure the Organization tab appears; if not, check role config in BUPT. In the Company Code tab assign your Company Code, enter a valid Reconciliation Account (check in FS00). Save and validate.

entry.title: Document types & Warehouse processing type determination in EWM - Blog 2
entry.content:
Intro:
This is not new but would be clarify some doubts for someone that how the document types and warehouse processing types will be determined in EWM.
Main part:
Let see more on how the documents will be choosen and how the inbound document types and categories will be mapped between the ERP and EWM.
Inbound in ERP VL31N - Document type - EL & Item Category - ELN


Inbound in EWM /n/SCWM/MON -
Doc Category PDI, Document type INB
Item category DLV, Item type IDLV.

Document type mapping in ERP
Here the ERP vs EWM inbound document header types has been mapped
SIMG - SCM EWM - EWM - Interfaces - ERP Integration - Delivery Processing - Map Document Types from ERP System to EWM

Map Item Types from ERP System to EWM
Here ERP vs EWM document item types has been mapped.
SIMG - SCM EWM - EWM - Interfaces - ERP Integration - Delivery Processing - Map Item Types from ERP System to EWM

Define Document Types for Inbound Delivery Process
Here the profiles against document type has been configured.
SIMG - SCM EWM - EWM - Goods Receipt Process - Inbound Delivery - Define Document Types for Inbound Delivery Process.

Define Item Types for Inbound Delivery Process
Here the profiles for item types has been configured only for the inbound deliveries.
SIMG - SCM EWM - EWM - Goods Receipt Process - Inbound Delivery - Define Item Types for Inbound Delivery Process

The profiles in EWM will choosen as below as per above configs made for INB document type.
Define Status Profiles
Here we can configure the status for each profiles.
SIMG - SCM EWM - EWM - Cross Process Settings - Delivery Warehouse Request - Status Management - Define Status Profiles

Similarly partner profiles will be maintained here.
SIMG - SCM EWM - EWM - Cross Process Settings - Delivery Warehouse Request - Partner Processing - Define Partner Profiles

Define Document Type Determination for Inbound Delivery Process
Here the document types for Inbound process has been maintained.
SIMG - SCM EWM - EWM - Goods Receipt Process - Inbound Delivery - Define Document Type Determination for Inbound Delivery Process.

Here you can see the warehouse processing type has been choosen as 1010. Let see how this has been choosen here


Defining the Warehouse process type.
SIMG - SCM EWM - EWM - Cross-Process Settings - Warehouse Task - Define Warehouse Process Type


Determine Warehouse Process Type
Using this configuration we can define which WPT to be picked for which documents.
SIMG - SCM EWM - EWM - Cross-Process Settings - Warehouse Task - Determine Warehouse Process Type
By above configuration system found the WPT to be picked as 1010 for the document type INB.
Now lets see on what ways we can pick the warehouse processing type.
1. Document Type
2. Item Type
3. Delivery Priority
4. Process Type Determination Indicator
Control Indicators for WPT determination
SIMG - SCM EWM - EWM - Cross-Process Settings - Warehouse Task - Define Control Indicators for Determining Warehouse Process Types


Later maintain the control indicator to the determination of warehouse process type again with PTDI.
SIMG - SCM EWM - EWM - Cross-Process Settings - Warehouse Task - Determine Warehouse Process Type
Maintain the same in /n/scwm/mat01
After this create a inbound delivery in ERP and in EWM the warehouse process order type will be picked as per the configuration.


Conclusion:
Hope this may help some one on understanding the Document mapping in EWM. Took reference from Sunils Udemy course.

entry.title: Re: F110 Printout Error / GL account is not defined
entry.content:
Some of the root causes are

  • The error “G/L Account is not defined in Chart of Accounts” (Message F5507) means the system is trying to post or reference a G/L account that does not exist in the operating chart of accounts assigned to your company code. Even if the account exists at company code level (SKB1), it must also exist at chart of accounts level (SKA1).
  • During print execution, SAP may call additional accounts (e.g., bank clearing, cash discount, exchange difference, charges). If any of these are not properly defined in FBZP → Bank Determination → Accounts or in the payment medium program configuration, the system will throw this error.
  • Check that the House Bank and Account ID used in the payment run are linked to the correct G/L account in FI12. If the G/L account assigned here doesn’t exist in the chart of accounts, the print step will fail.
  • For check printing, the system may require a check lot account or reference to a G/L account that hasn’t been created in the chart of accounts.

To fix this, go to fs00, select that G/L Account which throws the error message and ensure, it exists both in Chart of Accounts and Company Code levels. Go to fbzp and confirm the correct Bank Clearing Account is assigned for the payment method, house bank, and account ID. If using check printing, review FCHI (Check Lots) and ensure the account is valid. Double-check OBY6 (Company Code → Chart of Accounts assignment) to confirm the right chart of accounts is linked.

entry.title: Re: Inconsistent Sales Order Costing Behavior for Configu...
entry.content:
• If the requirements type → requirements class → costing variant assignment is not identical across plants, you’ll see different results.
  • If the valuation variant, costing sheet, or transfer control differs by plant, the costing variant determination will behave differently.
  • If master data (BOMs/routings) or valuation area settings differ, the costing results will diverge even if the strategy group is the same.

entry.title: Re: No control parameter entries found for document
entry.content:
Your post is not complete to understand the issue. Please answer the following:

  • What is the full error message (it should specify order type, plant, and controlling area)?
  • Which order type is being used for the process order?
  • Which plant and controlling area are involved?
  • Has the order type–plant–controlling area combination been configured in OPL8?
  • Is this issue happening for all process orders in that plant, or only for specific ones?
  • Was there any recent transport or config change (e.g., new plant, new order type, or controlling area assignment)?
